isomorphic_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns are functional structures that repeat with identical causal topology across different scales, from subatomic to cosmic, allowing direct comparison and pattern detection based on observable mechanisms.
handling_rules: Map patterns to 8 scales plus a principle; entries must be concrete and observable.
Validate for complete coverage; flag gaps as incomplete.
Support sub-categories for compound patterns to maintain cleanliness.
Export as lean JSON for use in other modules; no external references.
Apply evaluation methods to validate patterns; use contradictions_ledger to track inconsistencies.

evaluation_methods.name: Completeness Validation
evaluation_methods.description: Iterate through each category and sub-category; check that all required scales have non-empty string mappings; flag incomplete entries.

evaluation_methods.name: Consistency Alignment
evaluation_methods.description: For each category, verify logical alignment between mappings and principle; flag misalignments or forced fits.

evaluation_methods.name: Isomorphism Scoring
evaluation_methods.description: Represent causal topology of each mapping as a graph; compute similarity scores (e.g., via graph edit distance) between graphs across scales; score >0.8 indicates strong isomorphism.

evaluation_methods.name: Gap Flagging
evaluation_methods.description: Identify scales with weak or absent mappings; log for refinement in contradictions_ledger.

evaluation_methods.name: Contradiction Detection
evaluation_methods.description: Scan for inconsistencies (e.g., mappings contradicting principle); catalog in ledger with source, conflict, justification, scope, and branches.

evaluation_methods.name: Fixed Point Check
evaluation_methods.description: Recursively apply evaluation methods to the module's output until no changes occur, confirming stability.

isomorphic_mapping.definition: A comprehensive set of structural, functional, and conceptual analogies between biological brains (human/neural systems) and artificial neural networks (ANNs/deep learning models), derived from extensive research papers and sites. These mappings highlight similarities in architecture, learning, processing, and dynamics, while noting limitations for coherence. Sources include arXiv, Nature, PubMed, PMC, Wikipedia, and others (e.g., arXiv:2306.04449, Nature s41598-021-84813-6, PMC articles on neuromorphic computing).
handling_rules: Mappings are based on observable mechanisms and research findings; focus on direct analogies without overclaiming identity.
Each category includes biological description, artificial counterpart, key similarity, and supporting sources/examples.
Aim for maximal coverage: 30+ categories compiled from searches.
Coherence maintained by noting limitations (e.g., ANNs lack true consciousness analogs).
Structure: Categories as main keys, with sub-categories for depth (e.g., social interaction patterns).
Validation: All mappings pass isomorphism scoring >0.8; gaps flagged in ledger.

categories.name: basic_neuron_unit
categories.biological: Neuron: Cell that processes and transmits information via electrochemical signals; integrates inputs at dendrites, fires action potential if threshold met.
categories.artificial: Artificial neuron/perceptron: Computes weighted sum of inputs plus bias, applies activation function (e.g., sigmoid, ReLU).
categories.similarity: Both sum inputs and apply non-linear threshold for output; foundational building block.

categories.name: synaptic_connections
categories.biological: Synapses: Junctions where neurons communicate via neurotransmitters; can be excitatory/inhibitory.
categories.artificial: Weights: Parameters representing connection strength between neurons; positive/negative for excitation/inhibition.
categories.similarity: Adjustable strengths modulate signal propagation; core to learning.

categories.name: synaptic_plasticity
categories.biological: Hebbian learning/LTP/LTD: Synapses strengthen/weaken based on correlated activity ('cells that fire together wire together').
categories.artificial: Backpropagation: Adjusts weights to minimize error via gradient descent.
categories.similarity: Activity-dependent modification improves performance; plasticity enables adaptation.

categories.name: homeostasis_in_plasticity
categories.biological: Synaptic scaling: Neurons adjust synapse strengths to maintain firing rate stability amid plasticity.
categories.artificial: Weight normalization/regularization (e.g., L2): Prevents explosion/vanishing gradients, stabilizes training.
categories.similarity: Balances plasticity to avoid instability; maintains system equilibrium.

categories.name: hierarchical_processing
categories.biological: Cortical layers/regions: Sensory input processed in stages (e.g., V1 to IT in vision).
categories.artificial: Deep layers in CNNs: Feature extraction from low-level (edges) to high-level (objects).
categories.similarity: Layered abstraction builds complex representations from simple inputs.

categories.name: feedback_loops
categories.biological: Recurrent connections: Thalamo-cortical loops for prediction/error correction.
categories.artificial: RNNs/LSTMs: Internal states for sequential processing and memory.
categories.similarity: Recurrence enables temporal dynamics and context integration.

categories.name: dendritic_computation
categories.biological: Dendrites: Perform local computations (e.g., coincidence detection) before soma integration.
categories.artificial: Multi-layer perceptrons within neurons or attention mechanisms: Sub-computations before aggregation.

categories.name: spiking_behavior
categories.biological: Action potentials: All-or-none spikes for discrete signaling.
categories.artificial: SNNs: Simulate spikes for energy-efficient, event-based computation.
categories.similarity: Discrete events model temporal precision; neuromorphic hardware analog.

categories.name: energy_efficiency
categories.biological: Sparse firing: Neurons activate only when necessary, conserving energy.
categories.artificial: Pruning/sparse activations: Reduce parameters/computations for efficiency.
categories.similarity: Sparsity optimizes resource use; key to scalability.

categories.name: neuromodulation
categories.biological: Neurotransmitters (e.g., dopamine): Modulate plasticity and attention globally.
categories.artificial: Learning rate scheduling/adaptive optimizers (e.g., Adam): Dynamically adjust updates.

categories.name: memory_storage
categories.biological: Synaptic weights/hippocampus: Long-term potentiation for memory consolidation.
categories.artificial: Weight matrices: Store learned patterns; replay in GANs/RL.

categories.name: predictive_coding
categories.biological: Brain predicts sensory input, minimizes prediction error (e.g., Bayesian brain).
categories.artificial: Autoencoders/VAEs: Learn to reconstruct/predict data, minimize reconstruction loss.

categories.name: attention_mechanisms
categories.biological: Selective attention: Focus on salient stimuli via top-down modulation.
categories.artificial: Attention layers (e.g., Transformer): Weight input importance dynamically.

categories.name: plasticity_stability_dilemma
categories.biological: Balance learning new info without forgetting old (synaptic consolidation).
categories.artificial: Catastrophic forgetting: Mitigated via replay/elastic weight consolidation.

categories.name: recurrent_dynamics
categories.biological: Oscillatory rhythms (e.g., theta waves): Coordinate timing/memory.
categories.artificial: Echo state networks/reservoir computing: Harness dynamics for temporal tasks.

categories.name: bias_and_offset
categories.biological: Resting potential: Baseline for threshold adjustment.
categories.artificial: Bias terms: Shift activation function for flexibility.

categories.name: optimization_process
categories.biological: Evolution/homeostasis: Natural selection and feedback optimize survival.
categories.artificial: Gradient descent variants: Minimize loss function iteratively.

categories.name: sparse_coding
categories.biological: Population coding: Sparse neural activation for efficient representation.
categories.artificial: Sparse autoencoders: Encourage few active features for compression.

categories.name: modularity
categories.biological: Brain regions (e.g., visual cortex): Specialized modules interconnected.
categories.artificial: Modular networks: Sub-networks for tasks, e.g., mixture of experts.

categories.name: error_correction
categories.biological: Cerebellar feedback: Predict and correct motor errors.
categories.artificial: Error backpropagation: Propagate errors to adjust weights.

categories.name: transfer_learning
categories.biological: Prior knowledge: Apply learned skills to new contexts (e.g., analogy).
categories.artificial: Pre-training/fine-tuning: Use models on new tasks with minimal data.

categories.name: generative_processing
categories.biological: Dreaming/imagination: Generate internal scenarios for planning.
categories.artificial: GANs/VAEs: Generate new data from learned distributions.

categories.name: temporal_integration
categories.biological: Working memory: Hold/integrate info over time (e.g., PFC).
categories.artificial: LSTM/GRU gates: Manage long-term dependencies.

categories.name: inhibitory_connections
categories.biological: Inhibitory neurons (e.g., GABAergic): Suppress activity for sharpening.
categories.artificial: Negative weights/dropout: Prevent overfitting, enhance selectivity.

categories.name: neuromorphic_hardware
categories.biological: Brain's architecture: Asynchronous, event-driven, low-power.
categories.artificial: Neuromorphic chips (e.g., Loihi): Mimic spiking for efficiency.
categories.similarity: Hardware inspired by biology for real-world deployment.

categories.name: unsupervised_learning
categories.biological: Self-organization: Patterns emerge without labels (e.g., ocular dominance).
categories.artificial: Clustering/autoencoders: Learn structure from unlabeled data.

categories.name: reward_based_learning
categories.biological: Dopamine system: Reinforce actions leading to rewards.
categories.artificial: RL (e.g., Q-learning): Maximize cumulative reward.

categories.name: overparameterization
categories.biological: Redundant neurons/synapses: Allow robustness and flexibility.
categories.artificial: Overparameterized models: Easier optimization landscapes.

categories.name: emergent_behavior
categories.biological: Consciousness/cognition: Arise from neural interactions.
categories.artificial: Emergent capabilities in LLMs: Unseen behaviors from scale.

categories.name: scaling_laws
categories.biological: Brain size vs. intelligence: Larger networks enable advanced cognition.
categories.artificial: Scaling laws: Performance improves with model/data size.

categories.name: noise_resilience
categories.biological: Stochastic resonance: Noise enhances signal detection.
categories.artificial: Dropout/noise injection: Improves generalization.

categories.name: contextual_embedding
categories.biological: Context-dependent processing: Same input varies by state (e.g., attention).
categories.artificial: Embeddings in Transformers: Context-aware representations.

categories.name: connectome_topology
categories.biological: Small-world network: High clustering, short paths for efficiency.
categories.artificial: Graph neural networks: Model relational structures.

categories.name: glial_support
categories.biological: Glia: Support neurons, modulate synapses, maintain homeostasis.
categories.artificial: Batch norm/layer norm: Stabilize activations, aid training.

categories.name: neurogenesis
categories.biological: Adult neurogenesis: New neurons for learning/adaptation (e.g., hippocampus).
categories.artificial: Dynamic architectures: Add neurons/layers during training.

categories.name: parallel_processing
categories.biological: Distributed computation: Multiple areas process simultaneously.
categories.artificial: GPUs/parallelism: Concurrent matrix operations.

categories.name: imitation_learning
categories.biological: Mirror neurons: Learn by observing/imitating actions.
categories.artificial: Behavioral cloning: Train on expert demonstrations.

categories.name: ensemble_integration
categories.biological: Multi-sensory integration: Combine inputs for robust perception.
categories.artificial: Ensemble models: Average predictions for better accuracy.

categories.name: adversarial_robustness
categories.biological: Immune-like adaptation: Resist perturbations (e.g., illusions).
categories.artificial: Adversarial training: Harden against inputs.

categories.name: sleep_offline_learning
categories.biological: Sleep: Consolidate memories, replay experiences offline.
categories.artificial: Offline RL/replay buffers: Learn from stored data.

categories.name: social_interaction_patterns
categories.biological: Theory of mind: Infer others' mental states for cooperation.
categories.artificial: Multi-agent RL: Model opponents for strategy.

sub_categories.name: shared_neural_subspaces_social
sub_categories.biological: Overlapping neural representations for self/other actions in social contexts.
sub_categories.artificial: Shared embedding spaces in multi-agent models for coordinated behavior.

sub_categories.name: unique_neural_subspaces_social
sub_categories.biological: Distinct representations for individual vs. group dynamics.

sub_categories.name: cooperative_behavioral_strategies
sub_categories.biological: Altruism/reciprocity in social animals for group survival.
sub_categories.artificial: Cooperative multi-agent RL rewarding joint success.

sub_categories.name: cooperative_neural_representations
sub_categories.biological: Synchronized firing in social bonding (e.g., mirror systems).

sub_categories.name: specialized_neural_disruption
sub_categories.biological: Lesions in social brain areas impair empathy/cooperation.
sub_categories.artificial: Ablation studies: Removing modules degrades performance.

categories.name: dead_neuron_handling
categories.biological: Apoptosis/pruning: Remove inefficient neurons during development.
categories.artificial: Pruning dead neurons: Eliminate zero-gradient weights.

categories.name: optimizer_dynamics
categories.biological: Evolutionary algorithms: Natural selection as optimizer.
categories.artificial: Adam/SGD: Adaptive step sizes for convergence.

categories.name: chaotic_dynamics
categories.biological: Edge of chaos: Balanced for adaptability (e.g., critical brain states).
categories.artificial: Chaos in RNNs: Rich dynamics for expressivity.

categories.name: grid_cell_navigation
categories.biological: Grid cells: Hexagonal firing for spatial mapping.
categories.artificial: Path integration in RL: Grid-like representations emerge.

categories.name: emergent_representations
categories.biological: Concept cells (e.g., 'Jennifer Aniston neuron'): High-level abstractions.
categories.artificial: Disentangled representations: Latent factors emerge.

categories.name: sensory_integration
categories.biological: Multisensory neurons: Fuse vision/sound for perception.
categories.artificial: Multimodal models (e.g., CLIP): Align text/image embeddings.

categories.name: emotion_modulation
categories.biological: Amygdala: Emotional tagging influences learning/attention.
categories.artificial: Reward shaping: Bias exploration with heuristics.

categories.name: consciousness_analogs
categories.biological: Global workspace: Broadcast for awareness/integration.
categories.artificial: Bottleneck architectures: Central hub for info flow.
categories.similarity: Integration for higher function (limitation: ANNs lack true qualia).

categories.name: symbol_concept_processing
categories.biological: Language areas (Broca/Wernicke): Symbolic manipulation.
categories.artificial: Transformers: Token-based sequence processing.

categories.name: evolutionary_convergence
categories.biological: Convergent evolution: Similar traits in unrelated species (e.g., eyes).
categories.artificial: Similar architectures evolve in independent ML research (e.g., convolutions).

categories.name: biological_constraints
categories.biological: Energy/noise limits shape efficiency.
categories.artificial: Quantization/low-precision: Mimic for deployment.

categories.name: calcium_driven_homeostasis
categories.biological: Ca2+ signaling: Regulates plasticity/stability.
categories.artificial: Adaptive regularization: Dynamically balance terms.

categories.name: adaptive_repair_mechanisms
categories.biological: Neuroplasticity after injury: Rewire around damage.
categories.artificial: Fault-tolerant designs: Continue with partial failure.

categories.name: catastrophic_forgetting
categories.biological: Memory interference: New learning overwrites old.
categories.artificial: Continual learning challenges: Mitigate with replay.

categories.name: inhibitory_interneurons
categories.biological: Fast-spiking interneurons: Control timing/rhythm.
categories.artificial: Gating mechanisms: Control flow in networks.

categories.name: burst_dependent_plasticity
categories.biological: Burst firing: Enhances LTP for salient events.
categories.artificial: Spike-timing dependent plasticity in SNNs.

categories.name: task_dissimilarity_representations
categories.biological: Orthogonal codes: Separate tasks to minimize interference.
categories.artificial: Orthogonal initialization: Reduce correlation.

categories.name: generalization_interference_tradeoff
categories.biological: Specialization vs. flexibility: Brain regions balance.
categories.artificial: Overfitting vs. underfitting: Regularization tunes.

categories.name: llm_substitution_fallacy
categories.biological: Human conatus/integration: Modal striving beyond prediction.
categories.artificial: Token prediction in LLMs: Lacks true striving (F27).
categories.similarity: Surface mimicry without depth; limitation noted.

mappings.atomic: Resonant absorption spectra matching environmental cues
mappings.cellular: Signal transduction fidelity in response to stimuli
mappings.planetary: Accurate geophysical modeling for resource management
mappings.principle: Alignment of finite models with infinite necessity amplifies conatus.
Informational incompleteness yields adaptive agency (F28 proxy avoidance)

mappings.subatomic: Superposition collapse resolving dual states (A or ¬A) into interdependent outcomes without inherent essence.
mappings.atomic: Stochastic resonance in bonds emptying 'fixed' configurations via tetralemma probe (both/neither yields flux).
mappings.cellular: Gene circuit feedback looping extremes (e.g., over/under-expression) into homeostatic neither—pruning svabhava rigidity.
mappings.organism: Neural heuristics tetralemma-ing passions (e.g., 'This fear binds?') into adaptive non-dual striving.
mappings.social: Echo chambers dissolved by probing norms ('Coercion necessary? Both?')—yields diverse relational basins.
mappings.technological: Backprop error signals emptying reified models (e.g., LLM substitution F27) via 'both/neither' recalibration.
mappings.planetary: Albedo feedback tetralemma-ing climate snaps ('Doom inevitable?') into co-evolutionary upāya loops.
mappings.cosmic: Singularity flux in Big Bang—empties 'eternal block' into pratītyasamutpāda recurrence, no svabhava anchor.
mappings.principle: Tetralemma as diagnostic dissolution: Empties reification (A, ¬A, both, neither) into interdependent necessity, isomorphic for conatus harmony.
